tags: this has probably been done before but whatever
summary: the starks as brooklyn 99 quotes ned: oh i love being scary ned, he says what regular ned is thinking. (as scary ned) THIS IS...
body:
the starks as brooklyn 99 quotes

ned: oh i love being scary ned, he says what regular ned is thinking. (as scary ned) THIS IS TAKING TOO LONG, I’M GONNA MISS THE FARMER’S MARKET!

catelyn: my life stinks. ned is sick, my favorite mango yogurt got discontinued, and arya thinks her septa’s a stupidface

robb: i didn’t understand why people cared about their dumb dogs so much until i got a dumb dog myself. i’ve only had grey wind for a day and a half, but if anything happened to him, i would kill everyone in this room and then myself.

jon: the doctor said all my bleeding was internal. that’s where all the blood is supposed to be!

sansa: i was born for politics. I have great hair and i love lying

arya: be myself, what kind of garbage advice is that?

bran: the universe is a cruel and vexing puzzle. i am at the whim of the cosmos.

rickon: it’s real life die hard!! i mean, oh no, crime

blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary: I love Maisie Williams’ portrayal of show!Arya, but my woman loving feminist Book!Arya would’ve slapped the taste out of...
body: I love Maisie Williams’ portrayal of show!Arya, but my woman loving feminist Book!Arya would’ve slapped the taste out of Show!Arya’s mouth for some of the misogynistic things she’s said on the show 😤(and for her entire season 7 storyline with Sansa.)

blog.name: princessaryathevaliant
blog.title: Princess Arya the Valiant
blog.description: A devoted fan defending her precious cinnamon roll, its all you need to know!...and i love cheesecake...bye. Currently on hiatus.

summary: Arya haters: You guys only like arya because she fits your independent female warrior stereotype. Arya is such an unrealistic...
body:
Arya haters: You guys only like arya because she fits your independent female warrior stereotype. Arya is such an unrealistic and unrelatable character, her struggles are so fictional and no body can see themself in her.

Arya fans: Actually we can relate to her a lot. We also have had trouble meeting society’s unreachable beauty standards for women, and have been judged and bullied for it. Also, we also relate to her journey of finding herself and becoming comfortable with her identity.

Arya haters: Arya fans are too personal with Arya. They make all her struggles their own, thus cant judge her critically and analytically.

Arya fans:

summary:
****Sneak Peek at Chapter 18 of Winter Storm**** “And just what do you think you’re doing?”
Arya demanded in her best imitation...
caption:
****Sneak Peek at Chapter 18 of Winter Storm****

“And just what do you think you’re doing?” Arya demanded in her best imitation of Mother’s voice.

Sansa uttered a soft shriek of surprise, dropping the lemon cake that she’d been in the process of lifting to her mouth and spinning toward her, eyes wide with terror. Arya began to giggle just a little bit when Sansa clutched her chest like she’d had a horrid fright, her breath uneven and her expression one of terror before she recognised Arya.

“Oh, Arya!” Sansa shouted, swatting her in annoyance. “You scared me half to death!”

Arya laughed all the more.

“That was the point, Sansa,” Arya said. “Cook will be terribly cross with you when she wakes to find you’ve eaten all her lemon cakes before Aunt Lyanna can arrive.”

“I got hungry,” Sansa admitting, blushing prettily and lowering her head in shame, her hands cradling her pregnant belly.

Catch up here: https://www.fanfiction.net/s/11139862/1/Winter-Storm

blog.name: maisiestyle
blog.title: Maisie Williams | Arya Stark | Styles & Musings

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: My favorite relationships in GOT are Jon-Arya and Jon-Dany
I hope we get lots of both these pairings next season
And some Arya-Dany wil also be nice
Yes I am greedy for some good Jon moments next season
summary: Jonerys from the perspective of a Jon fan…
title: Jonerys from the perspective of a Jon fan…
body:
As a Jon fan I would like to explain why I like the Jon x Dany ship.

Being a Jon fan means that I relate to the character, agree with everything he does and will defend/justify his actions to the very end. I can acknowledge that he has flaws and at the same time try to see things from his POV.

As a book reader, my favorite Jon relationship is with Arya. I am a sucker for good big brother/little sister  relationships and Jon-Arya is one of the best sibling relationships present in the book. In fact I would go ahead and say that Jon-Arya is the best and most important relationship in the books, period. They love each other unconditionally and it’s healthy and all things good.  I mean, how can folks read things like this:

Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. He used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.

Bring her home, Mance… You owe me this one little girl.

What do you know of my heart, priestess? What do you know of my sister?

and not love them! I wish they would meet up soon and if there is one thing I am desperately looking forward to next season, it’s Jon and Arya reuniting again. If D&D mess this up, you can expect me to write long ranting essays on here about it!

And well, Jon and Ghost are pretty much about a boy and his dog and I love them to bits. Ghost is a part of Jon and I am glad he is around next season. And I love Jon’s bromance with Sam - best friends forever!

Now, coming to Jonerys, I knew that Jon/Dany would eventually meet and the books had foreshadowed some sort of an alliance between them. My favorite characters have always been Jon and Arya and while I liked Dany, I was not exactly all that invested in her story. Until last season that is.

And man, did I like her last season. The Lannisters have heaped untold misery on the Starks and Westeros for 7 seasons now and seeing Dany on Drogon and her Dothraki army crush them in battle was orgasmic. I was hoping for her to defeat Cersei/Jaime and cursing Tyrion for fucking up everything with his stupid plans. 

And well, I liked Jon and Dany’s burgeoning relationship. After two seasons of Sansa constantly telling Jon that he knows nothing and questioning his every decision, it was refreshing to have someone ask Jon for advice!  As per Sophie Turner’s comments at Comic Con – “[Sansa] doesn’t think he [Jon] has the intellect, the knowledge, and the experience that she has, and I concur.” This reflects in Sansa’s behavior towards Jon where she thinks that Jon should do as she says because she knows better.

But Jon is an intelligent, pragmatic leader. As Sam Tarly put it, he was elected twice to lead the Night’s Watch and the North. He ended an eight thousand year feud between the NW and the Wildlings, uniting the Free Folk with the North. He tried to make common cause with the enemy Boltons in order to unite against the White Walkers. People like Davos and Lyanna Mormont follow him because they see him as a true leader. Gendry just met the guy and he is immediately loyal. Jon has that effect on people. Theon points out how Jon always does the right thing – no matter how hard it is to do it. Jon understands the sanctity of treaties and deals and is pretty much the only leader in Westeros who holds true to his words.

And I like that Dany recognizes this and respects Jon’s ‘intellect, knowledge and experience’. She ignores Tyrion and asks Jon what he thinks she should do. And then takes his advice and attacks the Lannister/Tyrell army instead of KL. Towards the end, she takes his advice of sailing together to WF, overruling Jorah’s suggestion. I love it when characters acknowledge that Jon is a smart leader. I liked that she rushed North to save Jon, Jorah and the rest of them against Tyrion’s advice. I liked her telling Jon that though she disagreed with his announcement in the dragonpit, she respected his decision to do so.

I liked that Jon was diplomatic and treated Dany with respect as well – offering her his advice as a suggestion and leaving it up to her whether to take it or not.

I just loved the way Emilia Clarke played Dany falling for Jon. She was like a young girl falling in love for the first time. The way she asked Tyrion – ‘And what does the KITN want with Dragon glass?’ – it was like she found the KITN to be frustratingly cute and lovable despite having an obsession with the army of the dead! Or when she softly said ‘ you better get to work Jon Snow’ or how she could not hide her excitement at sailing together with Jon. I loved season 7 Dany.

I love that Jon now has the support of the most powerful leader in Westeros. It was getting a bit tiresome to constantly hear about how the Vale army was only there for Sansa. Well, Jon has now come North with the dragon queen, dragons, thousands of Dothraki and Unsullied, some great advisers and fighters. If Yohn Royce and the Vale wants to support someone else as leader, they are welcome to do so. Jon would be able to manage just fine without them.

And considering all the constant hate Dany has got here on Tumblr, I find myself defending her more and more. And it’s had the effect of making me like Dany all the more. Dany now joins the ranks of Jon and Arya as one of my favorite characters in the series. And well Jon loves her and I like the characters who make him happy and appreciate him for who he is.

So that’s my perspective on why as a Jon fan, I like the Jon-Dany relationship. I know folks are going to be rolling their eyes at the effusive praise I have heaped on Jon! But hey, he’s my fave and I think he deserves everything good so there it is 😊

I was hoping for her to defeat Cersei/Jaime and cursing Tyrion for fucking up everything with his stupid plans. 

And well, I liked Jon and Dany’s burgeoning relationship. After two seasons of Sansa constantly telling Jon that he knows nothing and questioning his every decision, it was refreshing to have someone ask Jon for advice!  As per Sophie Turner’s comments at Comic Con – “[Sansa] doesn’t think he [Jon] has the intellect, the knowledge, and the experience that she has, and I concur.” This reflects in Sansa’s behavior towards Jon where she thinks that Jon should do as she says because she knows better.

But Jon is an intelligent, pragmatic leader. As Sam Tarly put it, he was elected twice to lead the Night’s Watch and the North. He ended an eight thousand year feud between the NW and the Wildlings, uniting the Free Folk with the North. He tried to make common cause with the enemy Boltons in order to unite against the White Walkers. People like Davos and Lyanna Mormont follow him because they see him as a true leader. Gendry just met the guy and he is immediately loyal. Jon has that effect on people. Theon points out how Jon always does the right thing – no matter how hard it is to do it. Jon understands the sanctity of treaties and deals and is pretty much the only leader in Westeros who holds true to his words.

And I like that Dany recognizes this and respects Jon’s ‘intellect, knowledge and experience’. She ignores Tyrion and asks Jon what he thinks she should do. And then takes his advice and attacks the Lannister/Tyrell army instead of KL. Towards the end, she takes his advice of sailing together to WF, overruling Jorah’s suggestion. I love it when characters acknowledge that Jon is a smart leader. I liked that she rushed North to save Jon, Jorah and the rest of them against Tyrion’s advice. I liked her telling Jon that though she disagreed with his announcement in the dragonpit, she respected his decision to do so.

I liked that Jon was diplomatic and treated Dany with respect as well – offering her his advice as a suggestion and leaving it up to her whether to take it or not.

I just loved the way Emilia Clarke played Dany falling for Jon. She was like a young girl falling in love for the first time. The way she asked Tyrion – ‘And what does the KITN want with Dragon glass?’ – it was like she found the KITN to be frustratingly cute and lovable despite having an obsession with the army of the dead! Or when she softly said ‘ you better get to work Jon Snow’ or how she could not hide her excitement at sailing together with Jon. I loved season 7 Dany.

I love that Jon now has the support of the most powerful leader in Westeros. It was getting a bit tiresome to constantly hear about how the Vale army was only there for Sansa. Well, Jon has now come North with the dragon queen, dragons, thousands of Dothraki and Unsullied, some great advisers and fighters. If Yohn Royce and the Vale wants to support someone else as leader, they are welcome to do so. Jon would be able to manage just fine without them.

And considering all the constant hate Dany has got here on Tumblr, I find myself defending her more and more. And it’s had the effect of making me like Dany all the more. Dany now joins the ranks of Jon and Arya as one of my favorite characters in the series. And well Jon loves her and I like the characters who make him happy and appreciate him for who he is.

So that’s my perspective on why as a Jon fan, I like the Jon-Dany relationship. I know folks are going to be rolling their eyes at the effusive praise I have heaped on Jon! But hey, he’s my fave and I think he deserves everything good so there it is 😊
trail.content:
As a Jon fan I would like to explain why I like the Jon x Dany ship.

Being a Jon fan means that I relate to the character, agree with everything he does and will defend/justify his actions to the very end. I can acknowledge that he has flaws and at the same time try to see things from his POV.

As a book reader, my favorite Jon relationship is with Arya. I am a sucker for good big brother/little sister  relationships and Jon-Arya is one of the best sibling relationships present in the book. In fact I would go ahead and say that Jon-Arya is the best and most important relationship in the books, period. They love each other unconditionally and it’s healthy and all things good.  I mean, how can folks read things like this:

Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. He used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes.

Bring her home, Mance… You owe me this one little girl.

What do you know of my heart, priestess? What do you know of my sister?

and not love them! I wish they would meet up soon and if there is one thing I am desperately looking forward to next season, it’s Jon and Arya reuniting again. If D&D mess this up, you can expect me to write long ranting essays on here about it!

And well, Jon and Ghost are pretty much about a boy and his dog and I love them to bits. Ghost is a part of Jon and I am glad he is around next season. And I love Jon’s bromance with Sam - best friends forever!

Now, coming to Jonerys, I knew that Jon/Dany would eventually meet and the books had foreshadowed some sort of an alliance between them. My favorite characters have always been Jon and Arya and while I liked Dany, I was not exactly all that invested in her story. Until last season that is.

And man, did I like her last season. The Lannisters have heaped untold misery on the Starks and Westeros for 7 seasons now and seeing Dany on Drogon and her Dothraki army crush them in battle was orgasmic. I was hoping for her to defeat Cersei/Jaime and cursing Tyrion for fucking up everything with his stupid plans. 

And well, I liked Jon and Dany’s burgeoning relationship. After two seasons of Sansa constantly telling Jon that he knows nothing and questioning his every decision, it was refreshing to have someone ask Jon for advice!  As per Sophie Turner’s comments at Comic Con – “[Sansa] doesn’t think he [Jon] has the intellect, the knowledge, and the experience that she has, and I concur.” This reflects in Sansa’s behavior towards Jon where she thinks that Jon should do as she says because she knows better.

But Jon is an intelligent, pragmatic leader. As Sam Tarly put it, he was elected twice to lead the Night’s Watch and the North. He ended an eight thousand year feud between the NW and the Wildlings, uniting the Free Folk with the North. He tried to make common cause with the enemy Boltons in order to unite against the White Walkers. People like Davos and Lyanna Mormont follow him because they see him as a true leader. Gendry just met the guy and he is immediately loyal. Jon has that effect on people. Theon points out how Jon always does the right thing – no matter how hard it is to do it. Jon understands the sanctity of treaties and deals and is pretty much the only leader in Westeros who holds true to his words.

And I like that Dany recognizes this and respects Jon’s ‘intellect, knowledge and experience’. She ignores Tyrion and asks Jon what he thinks she should do. And then takes his advice and attacks the Lannister/Tyrell army instead of KL. Towards the end, she takes his advice of sailing together to WF, overruling Jorah’s suggestion. I love it when characters acknowledge that Jon is a smart leader. I liked that she rushed North to save Jon, Jorah and the rest of them against Tyrion’s advice. I liked her telling Jon that though she disagreed with his announcement in the dragonpit, she respected his decision to do so.

I liked that Jon was diplomatic and treated Dany with respect as well – offering her his advice as a suggestion and leaving it up to her whether to take it or not.

I just loved the way Emilia Clarke played Dany falling for Jon. She was like a young girl falling in love for the first time. The way she asked Tyrion – ‘And what does the KITN want with Dragon glass?’ – it was like she found the KITN to be frustratingly cute and lovable despite having an obsession with the army of the dead! Or when she softly said ‘ you better get to work Jon Snow’ or how she could not hide her excitement at sailing together with Jon. I loved season 7 Dany.

I love that Jon now has the support of the most powerful leader in Westeros. It was getting a bit tiresome to constantly hear about how the Vale army was only there for Sansa. Well, Jon has now come North with the dragon queen, dragons, thousands of Dothraki and Unsullied, some great advisers and fighters. If Yohn Royce and the Vale wants to support someone else as leader, they are welcome to do so. Jon would be able to manage just fine without them.

And considering all the constant hate Dany has got here on Tumblr, I find myself defending her more and more. And it’s had the effect of making me like Dany all the more. Dany now joins the ranks of Jon and Arya as one of my favorite characters in the series. And well Jon loves her and I like the characters who make him happy and appreciate him for who he is.

So that’s my perspective on why as a Jon fan, I like the Jon-Dany relationship. I know folks are going to be rolling their eyes at the effusive praise I have heaped on Jon! But hey, he’s my fave and I think he deserves everything good so there it is 😊
